definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: On carrying our his experiment, Faraday discovered electromagnetic induction.
sentences.chinese: 在進行實驗時，法拉第發現了電磁感應現象。

sentences.english: Faraday was the scientist who discovered electromagnetic induction.
sentences.chinese: 法拉第是發現電磁感應的科學家。

sentences.english: Exchange the silicon controlled rectifier to control, electromagnetic induction exports.
sentences.chinese: 交流可控硅控制，電磁感應輸出。

sentences.english: Electromagnetically induced transparency and slow light in ultracold Bose gas were investigated.
sentences.chinese: 研究了超冷玻色氣體中的電磁感應透明現象。

sentences.english: The electromagnetically induced two-photon transparency (EITT) under the control of coherent field is investigated.
sentences.chinese: 研究了相干場控制下的電磁感應雙光子光透明。
